item.title: Tomtoc Releases Nintendo Switch 2 Version Of Its Popular Form-Fitting Travel Case
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/tomtoc-releases-nintendo-switch-2-version-of-its-popular-form-fitting-travel-case/1100-6531332/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Carrying case and travel bag manufacturer Tomtoc has been a popular choice for Nintendo Switch and Steam Deck users for years. Now, like many other third-party companies, Tomtoc has launched its first options for Nintendo Switch 2. The manufacturer is known for its sleek, hardshell cases as well as its range of stylish shoulder bags, and the pair of Switch 2 Tomtoc products showcase exactly that. Tomtoc's Carrying Case and Crossbody Sling Bag are available to ship now from Amazon.

Tomtoc's hardshell case has quickly vaulted to the top of Amazon's list of the best-selling Nintendo Switch cases, and is pretty high up on the bestsellers list for gaming in general (as of May 6). With preorders for Nintendo's official Switch 2 carrying cases currently sold out, Tomtoc's cases will likely continue to be popular as we inch closer to the Switch 2's June 5 launch.

Tomtoc Hardshell Carrying Case for Nintendo Switch 2

$33.30 (was $37) with coupon

The Switch 2 version of Tomtoc's signature design, this hardshell case offers a form-fitting, sleek design. Tomtoc used water-resistant felt materials to provide a soft feel on both the outside and inside of the case. While you'll still want to carry your Switch 2 around carefully, if Tomtoc's Switch and Steam Deck cases are any indication, this Switch 2 case should provide ample protection. The precision fit, shock-absorbing cushions, and materials, which Tomtoc claims are lighter and sturdier than EVA, should keep your console snug and safe, whether it's bouncing around inside your backpack or (hopefully not) tumbling toward cement.

Other useful features include a sturdy buckle, an adjustable wrist-strap that can also double as a handle, and space to store up to 12 game cards.

Normally $37, you can save 10% on the price by clicking the coupon box below the price. There are three color options: black, gray, and white.

Tomtoc Crossbody Sling Bag for Nintendo Switch 2

$45 (was $50) with promo code

Tomtoc's other option gives you enough space to carry your Switch 2 and several accessories. This crossbody bag is also constructed from lightweight materials, and inside you'll find a dedicated compartment for your Switch 2. This section is crafted with an EVA hard shell to help shield against collisions, and there's a soft lining to help protect the Switch screen from any scratches.

You'll also find enough space here for a Switch 2 Pro Controller, up to eight game cards, a charger, and space for smaller accessories like additional cables and earphones.

You can also get a 10% discount on this bag by clicking the coupon on the page listing. Three color options are available: black, two-tone gray, and a red and white edition.

Tomtoc Shoulder Bag for Nintendo Switch 2 & Steam Deck

$50 (was $53)

If you have multiple large gaming handhelds, Tomtoc also offers a bag that is shaped to hold a Switch 2 or one of several mobile PC gaming handhelds like the Steam Deck or ROG Ally X. This plush shoulder bag has a removable EVA insert designed to protect your handheld from drops as well as plenty of space for accessories. Unlike the two options above, this Tomtoc bag isn't a brand-new release, but it's worth mentioning here because of its versatility and standing as one of Tomtoc's most popular travel bags.

The three cases above are just the tip of the Switch 2 iceberg when it comes to third-party accessories for Nintendo Switch 2 at Amazon. Some of the highlights here include hardshell carrying cases designed to offer a more durable option at an attractive price, like Spigen's Rugged Armor Protective Case/Grip for $30 at Amazon. JSAUX, another popular manufacturer of Steam Deck and Switch accessories, also just released a range of Switch 2 accessories for budget-friendly prices.

Here's a quick rundown of some of the other carrying cases, grips, and screen protectors that are available now for Switch 2.

More Nintendo Switch 2 Carrying Cases, Grips, & Protectors at Amazon

Switch 2 Ergonomic Grip Cases

  • Spigen Rugged Armor Grip Case -- $30
  • Spigen Dual Grip Case -- $30
  • Spigen Nano Pop Grip Case (Blueberry Navy) -- $30
  • Spigen Nano Pop Grip Case (Black Sesame) -- $30
  • Lmcpa Dockable Grip Case -- $14.60 ($20)
  • Supcase Military-Grade Dockable Grip Case (Multiple Colors) -- $20 ($22)
  • Mumba Dockable Grip Case (Bundles Available) -- $21

Switch 2 Carrying Cases

  • Lmcpa Hardshell Carrying Case (Nylon) -- $16 ($30)
  • Lmcpa Hardshell Carrying Case (EVA Plastic) -- $20 ($40)
  • ProCase Slim Hardshell Travel Case -- $17
  • CoBak Hardshell Carrying Case (Multiple Colors) -- $13
  • TZGZT Hardshell Carrying Case + 2 Screen Protectors -- $16.84 ($28)
  • Mumba Hardshell Slim Carrying Case (Multiple Colors) -- $19
  • Mumba Hardshell Large Carrying Case (Multiple Colors) -- $27
  • Fintie Hardshell Carrying Case (Multiple Colors) -- $20
  • amCase Hardshell Carrying Case (Multiple Colors) -- $25
  • Spigen Klasden Hardshell Carrying Pouch -- $42

Switch 2 Screen Protectors

  • iVoler Tempered Glass Screen Protector (3-Pack) -- $7 ($13)
  • iVoler Tempered Glass Screen Protector (4-Pack) -- $9 ($16)
  • amFilm Tempered Glass Screen Protector (3-Pack) -- $8

  • Ferilinso Tempered Glass Screen Protector with Alignment Frame (4-Pack) -- $7.64 ($13)

JSAUX Nintendo Switch 2 Accessories

  • Protective Case + Enhanced Grip -- $16 ($20)
  • Dockable Clear Shell + Joy-Con 2 Case -- $20 ($23)
  • Hard Shell Carrying Case (15 Card Slots) -- $18 ($26)
  • Slim Hard Shell Carrying Case with front cover (10 Card Slots) -- $17 ($26)
  • Ultra Slim Carrying Case (Orange and Blue) -- $19 ($22)
  • Protective Case for Joy-Con 2 -- $14 ($17)
  • Thumb Grips (Black) -- $13
  • Thumb Grips (Orange and Blue) -- $13
  • 2-Pack Anti-Glare Tempered Glass Screen Protector -- $10 ($16)
  • 3-Pack Tempered Glass Screen Protector -- $8 ($10)

Nintendo Switch 2 Official Accessories:

If you prefer to buy first-party accessories, here's a list of all of the Nintendo products releasing June 5. Check out our Nintendo Switch 2 accessory roundup for a closer look at each of the items listed below.

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $85
  • Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60
  • Switch 2 Camera -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $95
  • Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40

item.title: Battlefield 6 Will Be Fully Revealed This Summer, Launching By March 2026
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/battlefield-6-will-be-fully-revealed-this-summer-launching-by-march-2026/1100-6531349/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

EA and developer DICE have been running playtests for the next Battlefield game for several months, but we still don't know much about what's to come. That will change soon, as EA has shared during its May 2025 earnings call that it will fully unveil the next Battlefield this summer.

This announcement will come ahead of Battlefield's launch, which EA states will occur by the end of March 2026. CEO Andrew Wilson further shared that the development of Battlefield remains "on track," and that the company's changes in testing and iteration have allowed it to better prepare for a worldwide deployment.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Introducing Battlefield Labs | Battlefield Studios

DICE has periodically shared updates about its areas of focus during Battlefield's development process, such as efforts to improve environment destructibility and weapons balancing. However, specific information about gameplay mechanics, changes from Battlefield 2042, and especially the single-player mode have been kept under wraps.

DICE's development approach has included playtesters from the community from very early stages of development. Similar to EA's iterative process with the Skate series, this ongoing playtesting with members of the public has allowed DICE to refine game balance and mechanics, according to periodic updates from the studio. If you're interested in getting a chance to participate, you can still sign up to potentially join Battlefield Labs in a future wave.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Original GTA Designer Mike Dailly Praises Rockstar Delay After New GTA 6 Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/original-gta-designer-mike-dailly-praises-rockstar-delay-after-new-gta-6-trailer/1100-6531347/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Mike Dailly, one of the designers for the original GTA and a co-founding member of Rockstar North, said Rockstar made the right decision to delay GTA 6 after seeing the upcoming game's most recent trailer. Dailly made the comments on Bluesky, where he also praised the development team for not giving into greed and releasing a game that the studio knew could be improved.

Dailly said Rockstar undoubtedly knew GTA 6 would've sold exceptionally well even if it launched in a less-than-ideal state and called the studio's choice to delay it for extra polish "impressive."

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: GTA 6 (Grand Theft Auto VI) - Official Release Date Reveal | Trailer 2

"Now that's more like it," Dailly said in his post. "That environment is lovely, and things are moving much better… Even if they'd released it broken, it'd still have sold hugely. So it's even more impressive they took the decision to delay it. Kudos."

"Many of us are old enough to remember the debacle that Frontier: Elite II had on the PC, where greed got in the way," Dailly continued.

Frontier: Elite II launched in 1993, and while the space combat simulator received universal critical praise, it suffered from multiple, often game-breaking bugs on PC. Even those who remember it fondly recall how some of its essential features didn't work correctly, such as autopilot or rendering a planet.

Rockstar didn't publicly give a reason for GTA 6's delay after the announcement. However, as Dailly noted, the most recent version of Vice City looks crisper, and its inhabitants, from GTA 6's major characters to seemingly unimportant NPCs, move more naturally--in the in-game cutscenes, at least--compared to the first time Rockstar showed the game off.

GTA 6's new release date is May 26, 2026, for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S. A PC version of GTA 6 has not been announced, but is expected at a later, unspecified date.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: GTA 6's Jason: Does He Even Lift, Bro? Here's How Much He Can Bench
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-6s-jason-does-he-even-lift-bro-heres-how-much-he-can-bench/1100-6531346/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The new Grand Theft Auto VI trailer illuminated many new details about the highly anticipated open-world game, including the fact that main character Jason is absolutely shredded. The trailer opens with a shirtless Jason climbing down off the roof after doing some repairs. A close-up of Jason reveals he's got cannons for arms, a built back, and some impressive chest gains.

But how much can Jason bench? A sequence later in the trailer shows Jason on the beach, throwing up some impressive weight. In the trailer, we see Jason benching what appears to be 275lbs. Using weight plates from the amazingly fictional brand "GAINZ," we can see the outer-most plate is 25lbs. The inner ones look like 45-pound plates, so all of that weight combined with the bar (we are assuming it's the standard 45 pounds) and that comes to a mighty 275 pounds.

No matter what anyone says, a 275-pound bench is impressive. In gym and lifting culture, a bench press of 225 is the standard for what aspiring lifters hope to achieve. Given Jason's general buff-ness, I'm not surprised to see him putting up more, and having a well-rounded physique in general.

Also worth noting here is Jason's bench press form--it is very good. He takes the bar all the way down to his chest in a slow, controlled manner, making sure to not flare his arms out but keep the tight to his body. He also seems to not drop the weight in a straight line down to his chest. We could learn a thing or two from Jason's form.

Now, we can't say for sure what Jason's best bench is. It's possible Jason is not maxing out here but instead pumping for volume and muscle stamina. We do hear him grunt a little, but that doesn't mean he's struggling. He gets the weight up pretty easily, after all--earning the attention of a couple women nearby, too.

What I don't like to see here is Jason lifting all this weight without a spotter, or without a rack that has spotter arms. It's dangerous and unsafe to do this. But given Jason's line of work or robbing and shooting people as a drug-runner, it might be one of the safer activities he engages in.

Jason might be a gym bro, but we also see him in another sequence crashed out on the couch in the middle of the day with beers on his coffee table, so he clearly enjoys partying as well. Another scene shows Jason and Lucia at a club having a grand time. Remember, it's all about balance (minus the crime).

It's likely pumping out sets at the beach could be an activity in GTA 6, as Rockstar is known to allow players to do much of what they see in trailers for their games. Also, GTA 5 allowed players to hurl some weight around at an outdoor gym by the water as well, so it would be in keeping with tradition.

GTA 6 launches on May 26, 2026 for PS5 and Xbox Series X|S. That's a while to wait, so in the meantime, you can check out more than 150 new GTA 6 images in the gallery below. Beyond Jason and Lucia, GTA 6's story features a big cast of supporting characters. And in terms of places you'll visit, GTA 6 takes players to Vice City itself, along with the surrounding areas, like a park filled with wildlife.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: GTA 6 Preorders Are Not Yet Open
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-6-preorders-are-not-yet-open/1100-6531344/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Grand Theft Auto VI now has a release date and a new trailer, so it's understandable to think that Rockstar Games might have opened preorders for the open-world crime game. For other games, a publisher might begin preorders after confirming a release date and posting a flashy trailer to capitalize on the hype. But no, that's not the case for GTA 6.

Although we now know GTA 6 is set for release on May 26, 2026 for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S, retailers are not yet taking preorders. You should avoid any retailer currently trying to take your money to reserve the game, as it's likely a scam.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: GTA 6 (Grand Theft Auto VI) - Official Release Date Reveal | Trailer 2

Rest assured, when Rockstar announces preorder details for GTA 6, we'll report back with all the details. In addition to a standard version, it's expected Rockstar will offer premium-edition versions of the game, just like it did with GTA 5.

For comparison, preorders for GTA 5 opened in November 2012, which was after the first trailer arrived in November 2011. GTA 6, meanwhile, has already had two trailers, the first of which was released in December 2023; the second debuted on May 6, 2025.

In addition as to when GTA 6 preorders will open, another major unanswered question is how much GTA 6 might cost. With some AAA games jumping from $70 to $80, many are wondering if GTA 6 will follow suit or even potentially go higher, like $100, as some believe might happen. GTA 5 launched in 2013 priced at $60; that's about $80 in 2025 with inflation factored in.

Take-Two, many might recall, was the first major publisher to raise prices for AAA games from $60 to $70 with NBA 2K21. Take-Two defended the price hike and said it was generally accepted by fans.

GTA 6 is set in Vice City, which is a stand-in for Miami. The game also takes players to the surrounding area in the fictional state of Leonida, which is inspired by Florida. Beyond main characters Jason and Lucia, players will meet a variety of other supporting characters, including a conspiracy theorist.

While we wait for more information about GTA 6, you can check out 150+ screenshots from the game in the gallery below.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
